data.title: Plugins reverting to older version after updating Insiders
data.body:
- VSCode Version:

Version 1.8.0-insider
Commit 7499a9f3c565f4fbe5205e30c8664e5a5a11ae94
Date 2016-12-06T16:09:29.346Z
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0

- OS Version:

Ubuntu 14.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install [IDEA Keybindings](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=k--kato.intellij-idea-keybindings). Update the version of vscode insiders
2. You would see that the version of the extension vert back to 0.1.1 where as the latest version is 0.2.6

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.8.0-insider (7499a9f3c565f4fbe5205e30c8664e5a5a11ae94, 2016-12-06T16:10:17.195Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.3.4|
|vscode-docker|PeterJausovec|0.0.7|
|regex|chrmarti|0.0.7|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.1.0|
|ghlink|dt|0.0.4|
|tslint|eg2|0.6.0|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.7.2|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.2.2|
|diff|rafaelmaiolla|0.0.1|
|vscode-open-in-github|sysoev|1.2.1|

---

Testing #16208

Steps to Reproduce:

1. launch.json:
```
{
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "type": "node",
            "request": "launch",
            "name": "Launch Program",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/test.js",
            "skipFiles": [
                "*.js"
            ],
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}"
        }
    ]
}
```
2. test.js:
```
throw new Error('err');
```

It works as expected with `node2`.

data.title: Updates for extension not visible if we check for updates
data.body:
- VSCode Version:

Version 1.8.0-insider
Commit a8d5b9281e2118c2a10098098ddaac949ce69fe0
Date 2016-12-06T07:19:06.272Z
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0
- OS Version:
Ubuntu 14.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install any extension, wait for the new version to be published
2. You will not see the update as available.

The extension window still shows the older version. If you uninstall the extension & try to install, you will get newer version.

I faced this issue with [IDEA Keybindings](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=k--kato.intellij-idea-keybindings) multiple times.

data.title: How do you get a webview?
data.body:
Hi,

I am interested in developing an extension for VSCode. One thing remains unclear in my research. How
do I create a webview? I was looking at the previewHTML command and it doesn't seem to support 
loading HTML with a base URL. Part of my extension tries to load HTML I am writing under the context
of another base URL (i.e. against a server). In webview there is a loadDataWithBaseUrl function. Is there
any equivalent in vscode?

Cheers,

Nadeem

data.title: Match SSH connection string without username
data.body: In workspaceStats.ts the regex assumes there always is a username.

data.title: VS Code-tslint: no quickfix for "comment-format"
data.body:
While testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/16519:

Enabling "comment-format" options like "check-uppercase" etc. only offer quick fix for disabling the rule but nothing for fixing it.

data.title: Is there 64bit build for Windows?
data.body: Just wondered why Windows 64bit build is not available?

data.title: Chinese simplified 'hazni' not shown as expcted
data.body:
Testing #16547

Likely a bug in the wiki, but in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/IME-Test#windows-chinese,
type `hazni` results in '哈子你' not in '哈祝你'.

Same result when typing in WordPad.

If this is a issue in the wiki, let's fix it there.

data.title: vscode-tslint: no quick-fix for "ordered-imports" rule
data.body:
While testing #16519:

Enabling "ordered-imports" did result in some warnings in my test project but no quick fix lightbulb was showing up.

Since "ordered-imports" is listed on https://palantir.github.io/tslint/2016/11/17/new-for-4.0.html as having a fixer, it is not clear whether there is a problem with the corresponding quick fix in VS Code.

data.title: V8 Cache: error telemetry not working?
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. run out of sources
2. enable `configuration.nodeCachedDataDir` by removing the check for isBuilt in `windows.ts`
3. add console.logging into `onNodeCachedDataError` of `nodeCachedDataManager`
4. create a file `C:\Users\<username>\AppData\Roaming\code-oss-dev\CachedData\1.8.0` so that an attempt to write to there will fail because it is not a folder
5. start

=> console log is not being triggered
=> if you add console.logging into `loader.js` where `writeFile` is called you see errors

data.title: Preview activity bar icon reordering during drag operation (and let me be sloppy)
data.body:
Testing #16326

To reorder icons in the activity bar, I have to drag and drop the icon directly on the position I would like it to occupy.  I can't drop it between two icons and have it position between them.

This is generally OK, but when I want to put an icon at the bottom of the list I really just want to be sloppy and drag it to the bottom/empty area of the activity bar. I don't want to have to be accurate and drop it in the last position (the horror of having to be accurate!!)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1487073/20929228/830ab4d2-bbc9-11e6-81e0-aa2c562b8549.png)

It would be ideal if when i dragged the icon up or down you could see the other icons move around and almost preview what the activity bar will look like when it is dropped.

data.title: Snippets: default variable value makes snippet treat the variable as regular text
focus does not move to contributed viewlet after clicking on icon in activity bar
data.body:
Testing #16326
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0-insiders
- OS Version: MacOS

Steps to Reproduce:
1. clone/npm install/run https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-extension-samples/tree/master/tree-explorer-sample 
2. click on "dependencies" viewlet in activity bar

Result: nice vertical blue line next to the icon showing which one is selected...

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1487073/20928672/4240c402-bbc7-11e6-9a6b-ff59ae6506d8.png)

Pressing tab will put focus into the dependencies viewlet (shift tab will move focus to other icons in activity bar as expected).  

I would expect focus to be in the viewlet after clicking on the icon in the activity bar, in the same way it does for the other activities.

data.title: Runaway search processes should be killed when pressing Escape
data.body:
Testing #16416

I was trying to see if there's any handling for regexes that lead to catastrophic backtracking. Catastrophic backtracking in regexes is a quite fun topic. Read more at http://www.regular-expressions.info/catastrophic.html

* open the vscode repo
* search for ^(.*?,){11}P
* observe 100% CPU on all cores ;)
* press Escape
> observe 100% CPU on all cores does not stop

data.title: Store state of viewlets in activity bar in settings.json
data.body:
Testing #16326
MacOS
1.8.0-insiders commit a8d5b9

When opening multiple editor windows and then making changes to the activity bar icon order or visibility across those windows, it is not apparent which configuration will "win" on shutdown.  

Ideally, when you have multiple windows open and make a customization in one of the windows, it is immediately reflected in the other open instances, much in the same way toggling status bar visibility is. This way there are no race conditions/conflicts that need to be resolved on shutdown. The last state across all instances is the same, therefore that is the expected state when the tool is restarted.

data.title: [win] cached data clean up logic removes good data
data.body:
On Windows 10, open `C:\Users\<username>\AppData\Roaming\Code - Insiders\CachedData` and start insiders. Notice how snapshot files are being created but deleted like some seconds after startup.

![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/20928433/1ac6b950-bbc6-11e6-83dc-ea8669261ff8.gif)

I am not seeing any output in the console.

data.title: Warnings generated by Default settings are not cleared even after closing the editor

- See warnings in problems view
- Close the editor

Actual: They still remain
